TOKENS: k i ɲ e
NOTES: Mapudungun5 offers all numbers from 1 to 100. It is a manuscript done in a Mapudungun school; it only contains a few typos that I have corrected based on all other sources, i.e. Mapudungun1, Mapudungun2, Mapudungun3 and Mapudungun4.

TOKENS: e p u
NOTES: In the previous work, my main source was Mapudungun2, which is a reference dictionary hosted on the site of the University of Temuco. However, it is currently offline (I do not know why).

TOKENS: k ɘ l a
NOTES: Another source for numerals in Mapudungun is Chan's website (https://lingweb.eva.mpg.de/channumerals/Mapudungun.htm), which is a source we will site in general. However, the orthography and the phonetic/phonological interpretation I report here is slightly different on the basis of the available literature.

TOKENS: m e l i
NOTES: Regarding the phonological interpretation, I mostly refer to Mapudungun4
